intro: Trigonella occulta f. villosa, commonly known as the hairy trigonella, is a lesser-known variant of the trigonella genus. This plant is characterized by its hairy foliage, which gives it its specific epithet "villosa." It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant typically grows in dry, arid regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces pods containing small, kidney-shaped seeds.
